intro: Silene conica subsp. sartorii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Silene conica subsp. sartorii is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological diversity.
